comments.commentBody: Conservative evangelicals are only too happy to kill the Iran deal as well because it fits their logic for Armageddon ASAP.  It also BTW fits the logic of ISIS.  The American voters allowed themselves to vote for Republican nutcase extremists masquerading as sincere conservatives, and not only has it delayed economic recovery but it is likely to kill many middle class citizens as well in a variety of ways because of cuts in government services and support.  I believe that we've answered Franklin's comment about a Republic: We had one and we couldn't keep it.

But one thing we human beings have to stop doing is speaking for God. And playing God by making other people obey whatever WE say God wants. That is fundamentalism, and it is generally nasty.
Yes, there are scriptures, but they were written when we were a lot more primitive and they might inspire us but should never limit us. Or be used by anybody to limit us.
Unless they are really simple, like the Buddha's (you face old age, disease and death; therefore cultivate your spirit by living in the present in harmony, and support this by applying intelligent discipline). Cool.
And also, we need to stop using capital letters to make things so solemn that nobody can question them. By what virtue does personal responsibility become Personal Responsibility?
So instead of quoting old texts and using God as a stick (which an anthropologist will tell you is a ploy ALL primitive cultures used to make people behave), let us have a reasoned liberal morality, and in this case, respect the rights of women to make their own decisions, and support them.
Your commend is satirical, right?

If fixing problems the wrong way is blocked, they will have to be fixed the right way. If fixing them the wrong way is allowed, they will never be fixed the right way because they will be fixed another way. The right way is Personal Responsibility, the way of God. Any other way that fixes the problem undercuts Personal Responsibility.

This is the logic of the conservatives, and it makes perfect sense. We follow this logic when we refrain from cutting corners. It is wrong because God wants us to love our neighbors, and this may involve helping people achieve Personal Responsibility as one of several goals, but not forcing Personal Responsibility on them whether they are ready or not. The conservative attitude seems to be that the best way to teach people to swim is to throw them in the deep end so that if they do not figure it out they will have to be pulled out and revived and thrown in again.

I think it's being repeated over and over again by pundits like Douthat who can't accept the fact that Trump's campaign for president is no less ridiculous and ludicrous than Jeb Bush's campaign. After all, George W. and Jeb Bush make Fidel and Raul Castro look like John and Robert F. Kennedy.

The Bushes are nasty people who fight dirty. They try very hard to look all courtly and statesmanlike, but in fact they are like silk stockings filled with mud. Trump's celebrity status will make him less vulnerable to the kinds of attacks by the Bushes that doomed campaigns of previous GOP challengers to the Bush family, like Bob Dole in 1988 and John McCain in 2000.

Hence the obsession with dismissing Trump. He stands a better chance than anybody since Reagan in 1980 of beating a Bush family member for the GOP presidential nomination.

Thank you.  It is impossible to conceive how a group of elected representative can so blithely ignore the potential breakthrough, not because there is some better alternative, but simply for partisan gain.  They follow the lead of the "worldly" Tom Cotten.  They ignore anything that has not been heard in the echo chamber that is the Tea Party tumor that used to be the Republican Party.   Getting Russia and China to agree, to come to that table as allies, not adversaries, to honor the sanctions, to agree not to use their veto power and instantly impose sanctions, should Iran fail to honor the agreement, that alone was a major diplomatic coup.  It strains credibility to imagine the lightweights and megalomaniacs, currently outshouting one another to get a spot on the debate roster, coming up with the concept, let alone executing it successfully.  Their solution, more sanctions, didn't work in Cuba and only worked in Iran because Russia, China, and our allies all agreed to actually honor them.

@bob They have no compunction about disbelieving the Pope when he speaks out about the real dangers of climate change. These boneheads wouldn't believe Jesus and all the prophets and the saints if they appeared before them if the message contradicted their positions.

I sincerely appreciate this much-needed commentary on the merits of the proposed agreement between the Islamic Republic of Iran and the world's foremost nuclear powers.  And, I wish that the naysayers would pay more attention to Secretary Moniz and the world-class expertise he brought to the negotiating table.  Of course, the Republican opponents will attempt to discount him (and, vicariously, Messrs. Obama and Kerry) because they don't "trust" scientific judgment from acknowledged experts, on this issue or on climate change or on sex ed for teenagers or on recidivism reduction through education or any number of any other topics.  Why can't the American public wake up to these no-nothings?  I'm exasperated, but still hopeful that sanity will prevail.
@ sdavidc9:  "Revived"!  I'm sure you expect us to know many of them would die.  Unfortunately that is exactly the Republicans' attitude.

I am on the liberal-progressive side of most things, but respected some conservatives in the past. I thought Bush 1 was a generally good president and, smart enough not to create a vacuum by getting rid of Hussein, and by going back on his 'read my lips' pledge actually set the country up for the economic expansion of the 90s and the budget surplus at the end of the Clinton administration.

I turned away from the Republican party when Bush 1 didn't denounce Buchanan's speech at the 92 convention. It has gotten much worse since then.

I have been waiting for remaining sensible Republicans to come out and say that they've had enough and can't take it any more.

Thanks and best wishes.

And that other guy from Arkansas - Senator Tom Cotton. Shame on him too. As my brother said it's embarrassing for all the great graduates from Harvard Law School to have fellow alumni like Senators Cotton and Cruz.

I am a lifelong registered Republican, and am embarrassed by the Republicans currently. Their self-serving obduracy, obduracy borne of unending and illogical opposition to Barack Obama and kowtowing to the pro Israeli lobby, is detrimental to this country.

Shame on Mike Huckabee and his ilk.
not to mention more than a few people inside the USA!
Unfortunately, they don't care. They actually are probably proud of that status.

It is outrageous that a bunch of unintelligent cowboys (for that is what the US congress is) can try to derail an international agreement which has been achieved by seven nation states, namely the P5+1, and Iran.  These congressmen and women in the view of many, represent the peak of hypocrisy and double standards, and it is sad that they do not realise how much they are despised by people outside the USA.

Growing up with alcoholic parents from a line with mental illness and alcoholism as far back as anyone could remember, on both sides, I have worked to be stable and sane myself.  Part of that was choosing early on, that I would not procreate. I had surgery to prevent that, and that is one of my finest life achievements--no more broken children at birth.

The alternative is not a better deal.  The better deal is unachievable.  The alternative is bombing, followed by invasion and occupation when the bombing delays but also enrages and unifies them and makes hard-line crackdowns acceptable.  Bombing not followed by invasion will yield a nuclear and very angry Iran

Republicans don't only hate government successes; they hate personal choice, unless it's the choice of a boss to screw the employees with low pay, or short hours, or gutted pension funds, or abandoned health insurance.  Sad to say that applies to top political bosses as well, if not more so.  Democrats and Republicans have gutted public pension funds; judges abolish legal obligations to pay workers but not banks, and so on.  Though both parties' officials do it, the Republicans make a deliberate policy of it and want to make it universal; they are the worse evil by far.

I must say that though I found that most of the findings reported here made sense, I found this piece disappointing. Most of what was reported here seems to be fairly obvious to anyone who pays much attention to what is going on in American society. I suppose it's useful to have it confirmed by the academy but I had sort of hoped for some deeper insights into what it is about human nature that can lead to such examples of systemic racism as exist in America. This seemed more just a fairly detailed analysis of how racism manifests in America, than an analysis of its causes. I'm not saying that would be necessarily easy to do, just that I usually look to this column for insights that we ordinary folk typically miss.

Does everybody on earth include the Brits, the French, the Germans, the Russians and the Chinese?  Or just the Israelis?  Anyway, no one is downplaying the detestable behavior of Khameini and company (though you've gone way overboard in projecting their intentions), but leaving them without sanctions and without inspections pretty much ensures that your worst fears will come true.  BTW: Who sent you "a message that (you) will be dead soon"?  Hope you notified the proper authorities.

By definition one doesn't have to negotiate with one's friends.
One negotiates with adversaries.

A step in the direction of reducing a nuclear threat is good. What's the alternative?

massed dolati,

Your comments describing Iran in the first paragraph sound more like Saudi Arabia to me. Yet somehow we have no trouble "dealing" with them and we for some reason "trust" them.

The Iran Deal
most people don't even have a clue what kind of evil empire they are dealing with when it comes to ayatollah's Regime and their financing, training, and exporting Terrorism, torture, executions of, women’s & underage high school students, Human rights violation, creating Hezbollah & Basiege in the middle east, Africa, and South America, Shia Militia in Iraq, Hootheis in Yemen, and running the Assad's regime massacres in Syria.

Khomeini's theory on building a Muslim Empire under his complete control had to have nuclear bombs as survival insurance and the Ayatollahs will do any deception to achieve this goal. They have sworn on it and will not give up. When I wrote an OP-ED about this commitment in Atlanta Const. Journal, they sent me a message that I will be dead soon.

They have always had two parallel policies about nuclear program. First to try to remove all the sanctions by any means necessary and second continue developing the bomb in unknown secret sites. That is why everybody on earth agrees that they can't be trusted.

@ Eric:  Instead of these hyper-moralists being saints at any age, I strongly suspect they are cheaters in many aspects of morality.  They're covering up, often unconsciously, and that's one reason they are so dogmatic about (their) morality.  That is what I suspect, and there is occasionally a slip of the mask that exposes exactly that.  I don't except Democrats, but far fewer Democrats are so hypocritical and they don't make a policy platform out of it
Larry:  You hit the nail on the head, in few words.

This deal covers Imports, so those advanced centrifuges, or parts, or materials (such as alloys) should they try to build their own advanced centrifuges, are very likely to be flagged.

Don't forget, this deal isn't between us and Iran. There are a whole bunch of other nations much closer to their nuclear potential than we are, who are signatories to this thing and have every interest in the world to make sure Iran cannot cheat on this deal.

There's a reason why our arch-enemy Putin signed onto this, and he's not in the habit of doing America any favors.

Reply to MIke Dolati, CA:

Both you and another gentlemen by the name of Masoud Dolati make this argument that President Obama and other world leaders are naive, ignorant, and unable to recognize the duplicity inherent in the Ayatollah's intention.

Why would a world leader like Mr Obama compromise security of a country sheilded by US since its inception? Why would he and Mr Kerry spend these countless hours to find a peaceful solution to this problem by developing a consensus with European Allies that they all agree on? Do you have inside information about Iran that they do not? Your exaggerations and paranoia are painfully lacking in a logic and facts. Sorry.

Hey, Mike, how would you feel if Iran convinced the U.N. to send inspectors anytime anywhere to American military sites?  In case you've forgotten the only country that's ever launched a nuclear weapon at another country is the one you're living in.

Obama said that it is a wrong criticism to say that Iranian Regime will eventually cheat and will build a nuclear bomb and we will monitor
their key known nuclear facilities 24/7. In this agreement UN and IAEA have
only listed the 8 known facilities that were exposed by the Iranian Resistance. What about the 7 other military and secret facilities like Parchin & Lavizan-3, SPND, etc., that Iranian Resistance has exposed recently and they are not on this list and now we find out that there is a secret agreement on them.
Isn’t it true that this agreement will give the biggest exporter
of the international terrorism more than 24 days to clean up their secret
nuclear site or this is another dishonest argument? Didn’t you agreed on
Managed access with significant delays, which takes away the surprise element? do you text a thief that you are coming home before you get there? Did you hear what Khamenei said today on the Iranian national TV that they will not allow any inspection of their major military sites?
Is this a overheated argument that the agreement did not
mentioned anything about the R&D on the advanced centrifuges including
IR-4, IR-5, IR-6 and IR-8, which are significantly more efficient and only few
hundreds of them can generate enough enriched uranium to make a nuclear bomb.

As important if not more so, whom can we count on as allies if we keep moving the goal posts?

England, France, Germany, Russia, and China would never take us seriouslyor be willing to support our position again.
Who will ever again negotiate with an America that moves the goal posts at the whim of Israel's bought off lackys and fellow travelling, rapture-crazed lunatics like Bachman and Huckabee?

I am not sure it will make any difference, but I personally went to PP, and did not want or need an abortion. I had a pap smear, breast exam and referral for a mammogram, and I was supplied with medically correct interpretations of the test results. I was offered the opportunity to be tested for a variety of sexually transmitted diseases. I did not need these services but was glad they were available if I ever did. I am forever grateful for the medical expertise available, but the caring and compassion of the doctors and staff. In comparison, the other option was the local county health department - with a three month waiting period due to lack of professional staff.

I am white, and 60 years old, with a long,successful career, in management. I know that goes again all stereotypes, and I hate to be a disappointment. I am also not an exception.
Agreed, we should have no relations with the biggest exporter of terrorism, Saudi Arabia, or the epicenter of global terrorism, Pakistan.

O
Oh my oh my. More nation building or attempted covert overthrow of a sovereign nation's recognized government by the CIA and Secret OPs. Just what the situation calls for as long as you don't care that these kind of imperial actions by Western governments have directly led to the strife tearing the ME - and other regions of the world apart.

President Obama said that this was a question of war or peace. do you think that giving the Ayatollahs more than $100 billion dollars in cash and removing all the sanction from their terrorist organizations will help stopping the genocides by the biggest terrorist in the middle east, Khamenei top general, Qasem Solaymani and his Quds terrorist (external portion of Revolutionary Guards of Regime), Assad’s regime in Syria, Shia militias in Iraq, Houthis in Yemen, and Hezbollah in Lebanon and bring Peace and stability to the Middle-East?
We don't want America to get involve in another war in middle-east or have an appeasement policy towards terrorist regime of Iran. There is a third option.
Support the Iranian opposition & the Iranian resistance forces. The majority of the Iranian people want freedom & regime change in Iran, a non-nuclear & secular
regime, freedom & democracy and a true referendum /election in Iran.
Iranian people can & will over-trough this biggest fascist dictator since Adolf Hitler without military involvement of any foreign country. Involvement of any outside forces will unite the Iranian people with these murderous Ayatollahs due to their nationalistic feelings.
We should not negotiate from the position of weakness with the biggest financier &
exporter of international terrorism on earth and have an appeasement policy
toward such a murderous regime. We could and we should force a stronger
agreement down their throat.

Isn’t it true that they had to come to these negotiations on their bloody knees because of the sanctions has destroyed their economy and
every day the unpaid workers were in the streets screaming that they want their unpaid wages for the past eight months and then they scrim death to Dictator .
Did the $800 billion that the regime made during the Ahmadinejad regime, help the Iranian people or Assad & Hezbollah & Quds terrorists? Why give
them all the mentioned concessions and risk the safety of the entire world.
Haven’t you learn that the ayatollahs only understand the language of force?
Harder & tougher Sanctions to bring them back to the negotiation table on their knees and this time require surprise inspection 24/7 anywhere anytime. No R&D on new technology, IR4, IR5, IR6, & IR8 centrifuges which 100 of them can produce an atomic bomb. The majority of sanctions were from our government and we punished the European Governments, & banks Billions of dollars for washing the Iranian oil money through their banks.

When Netanyahu snubbed President Obama and addressed the Congress this spring, in a campaign spectacle, the symbiotic relationship between American legislators and the Prime Minister was laid bare.  Both political entities look to manipulate populaces with a message that they are the safeguard against enemies.  Both political entities would, in fact, rather maintain enemies and lead by fear (Senator Graham: "Iran is the enemy") than take concrete, longterm, diplomatic steps like Kerry's team to keep us and other nations safe.  Cynicism may be short-term politically expedient, but real and respectable leadership comes from the real hard work like Obama and cabinet.
I'm wondering how many Republicans have read the entire document.  Probably not many as grandstanding is so much more fun sans understanding.
"Trust but verify" claimed Reagan, and Obama's deal does that, but to a much greater depth.
KnowNothing, I hope all your readers catch the irony.  The two replies I see may or may not, but they provide support for your position.
One can only hope.

Yes, the behavior of the Republicans is disgusting, but I am pleased to admit to an extraordinary amount of schadenfreude over Republican self-destruction.

I am grateful to Donald Trump for lowering the Republican candidates to name calling and verbal mud wrestling.

I would never vote for any of these clowns but am looking forward to 'The Donald' in the debate.

The Party is truly in death throes.  Dominated by the ignorant and the malevolent, it can only dance bizarre tribal dances as it plunges ever deeper into the primal ooze. The behavior of the party is disgusting.

Good old Huckabee, the firm believer in immaculate conception. Men, and their contributions to unwanted pregnancies seldom feature in his calculations , otherwise he would simply send in the army to mow down male citizens. Problem solved.
There will be more abortions. However, they will be accompanied by dead female bodies and bloody coat hangers.

@ACW: that is provably ridiculous.

First off, when women did back alley abortions and coat hangers and the like, there was a huge social stigma about unwed pregnancy -- it was shameful, it was immoral, it would get you thrown out of your family home, etc. Today, it is not only NOT immoral, it is the norm -- even in the most conservative parts of the nation.

There is no reason to use a coat hanger or back alley, when it is 100% normal and accepted.

For the rest of those who just don't want a baby -- there is RU 486, which can be had by mail and used without a doctor, and is quite safe and very effective.

There is also Plan B (yes, I know how it works and it's not an abortifacient) which you can get cheaply at every pharmacy, even girls as young as 9 or 10.

So in fact, that is distorted hyperbole. We already do a million legal abortions, each and every year, and a good many of them apparently on late term babies (HEALTHY late term babies) and on healthy women, so that their fetuses can be sold for body parts and experiments.
There won't be more abortions. Mike Huckabee says he'll send federal troops and the FBI to prevent women from having abortions. (Yes, he really did.)
